definition: to inspect/to review/to read/to peruse/to go through/to experience
room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: It is required that nobody (should) smoke in the reading-room.
sentences.chinese: 按要求，谁都不许在阅览室吸烟。

sentences.english: You ought not to have taken the book out of the reading-room.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该把书带出阅览室。

sentences.english: He reentered the reading room by another door.
sentences.chinese: 他从另一个门又进入阅览室。

sentences.english: The building being repaired is our reading-room .
sentences.chinese: 现在维修的那栋楼是我们的阅览室。

sentences.english: The reading room closes at 10 p.m .
I learned a lesson in the reading-room that I will remember all my life.
sentences.chinese: 我在阅览室里学到一个终生难忘的教训。

sentences.english: Our classroom is used as a reading-room.
sentences.chinese: 跹我们的教室被用来当阅览室使用。

sentences.english: They transformed the basement into a reading room.
sentences.chinese: 他们把地下室改建成阅览室。

sentences.english: Only teachers of this school can use the on-line reading-room.
sentences.chinese: 只有本校教师才可以用收集阅览室。

sentences.english: Soon our comic-book library was open to the public.
sentences.chinese: 很快我们的小人书阅览室就对外开放了。

sentences.english: Everybody in the reading-room looked up from their books at me unfriendly.
sentences.chinese: 阅览室里所有的人都抬起头，异样地看着我。

sentences.english: This reading-room is only used by teachers.
sentences.chinese: 这间阅览室只供教师使用。

sentences.english: He has been in the reading-room since after lunch.
sentences.chinese: 午饭后他一直呆在阅览室里。

sentences.english: Reading room for teachers and students.
sentences.chinese: “乳源教师进修学校”师生阅览室。

sentences.english: Let me show you the room to be used as the teachers'reading-room.
sentences.chinese: 我来带你看看要用作教师阅览室的那个房间。

sentences.english: They turned the reading room into a laboratory.
sentences.chinese: 他们把阅览室改建成了一个试验室。

definition: books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
a store room for books/fig. an erudite person/the Bibliotheca and Epitome of pseudo-Apollodorus
teashop with performance by 評書|评书 story tellers/(attached to name of publishing houses)/(in former times) private school/library (of classic texts)
to study outside of class time (reviewing one's lessons)/to study in one's free time/individual study
